title: Only an election can end this saga
text:
How quickly triumph can turn to dust. Boris Johnson secured the support of MPs by a majority of 30 votes for his Brexit deal legislation only to see victory snatched away 30 minutes later when the Commons rejected his timetable for delivering it. As a consequence, the Prime Minister was forced to “pause” the measure pending talks with the EU about an extension to the UK’s membership.

Mr Johnson had earlier indicated that he would abandon the Withdrawal Agreement Bill entirely and seek an election had he lost the second vote, but stopped short of doing so. An election would require the support of two-thirds of all MPs. Given its apparent inability to resolve the greatest political issue of recent...
description: How quickly triumph can turn to dust.
